verses.verse: Whither <WH575> is thy beloved<WH1730> gone,<WH1980> O thou fairest<WH3303> among women?<WH802> whither<WH575> is thy beloved<WH1730> turned aside?<WH6437> that we may seek<WH1245> him with<WH5973> thee.
My beloved<WH1730> is gone down<WH3381> into his garden,<WH1588> to the beds<WH6170> of spices,<WH1314> to feed<WH7462> in the gardens,<WH1588> and to gather<WH3950> lilies.<WH7799>
I <WH589> am my beloved's,<WH1730> and my beloved<WH1730> is mine: he feedeth<WH7462> among the lilies.<WH7799>
Thou <WH859> art beautiful,<WH3303> O my love,<WH7474> as Tirzah,<WH8656> comely<WH5000> as Jerusalem,<WH3389> terrible<WH366> as an army with banners.<WH1714>

Turn away<WH5437> thine eyes<WH5869> from<WH4480> <WH5048> me, for they<WH7945> <WH1992> have overcome<WH7292> me: thy hair<WH8181> is as a flock<WH5739> of goats<WH5795> that appear<WH7945> <WH1570> from<WH4480> Gilead.<WH1568>

Thy teeth<WH8127> are as a flock<WH5739> of sheep<WH7353> which go up<WH7945> <WH5927> from<WH4480> the washing,<WH7367> whereof every one<WH7945> <WH3605> beareth twins,<WH8382> and there is not<WH369> one barren<WH7909> among them.
As a piece<WH6400> of a pomegranate<WH7416> are thy temples<WH7451> within<WH4480> <WH1157> thy locks.<WH6777>
There <WH1992> are threescore<WH8346> queens,<WH4436> and fourscore<WH8084> concubines,<WH6370> and virgins<WH5959> without<WH369> number.<WH4557>

My dove,<WH3123> my undefiled<WH8535> is but one;<WH259> she<WH1931> is the only one<WH259> of her mother,<WH517> she<WH1931> is the choice<WH1249> one of her that bore<WH3205> her. The daughters<WH1323> saw<WH7200> her, and blessed<WH833> her; yea, the queens<WH4436> and the concubines,<WH6370> and they praised<WH1984> her.
Who <WH4310> is she<WH2063> that looketh forth<WH8259> as the morning,<WH7837> fair<WH3303> as the moon,<WH3842> clear<WH1249> as the sun,<WH2535> and terrible<WH366> as an army with banners?<WH1713>

I went down<WH3381> into<WH413> the garden<WH1594> of nuts<WH93> to see<WH7200> the fruits<WH3> of the valley,<WH5158> and to see<WH7200> whether the vine<WH1612> flourished,<WH6524> and the pomegranates<WH7416> budded.<WH5132>
Or ever<WH3808> I was aware,<WH3045> my soul<WH5315> made<WH7760> me like the chariots<WH4818> of Ammi-nadib.<WH5971> <WH5081>

Return, <WH7725> return,<WH7725> O Shulamite;<WH7759> return,<WH7725> return,<WH7725> that we may look<WH2372> upon thee. What<WH4100> will ye see<WH2372> in the Shulamite?<WH7759> As it were the company<WH4246> of two armies.<WH4264>
